page.title: Las frases nominales - La concordancia del poseedor
page.introduction:
La concordancia del poseedor se manifiesta comúnmente de dos formas básicas:
Un afijo que se encuentra en sustantivos poseídos alienables para indicar que están poseídas y por lo tanto deben tener un poseedor en la frase nominal. Los sustantivos poseídos inalienables no tienen ningún indicador, sino que siempre deben tener un poseedor. Éstos incluyen, pero no se limitan a, los términos del parentesco y las partes del cuerpo.
Un afijo que corresponde al poseedor (o expresa posiblemente al poseedor en sí mismo).
Cada tipo será considerado en su orden correspondiente.

radioGroup.prompt: ¿Su idioma distingue sustantivos en medio de poseídos alienables u inalienables?

form.prompt: Escriba los afijos que se utilizan para indicar sustantivos poseídos alienables cuando tienen un poseedor en la caja (cada uno en una línea separada si más de una). Utilice un guión después de los caracteres alfabéticos para indicar un prefijo, un guión antes para indicar un sufijo, y guiones en ambos lados para indicar un infijo.
form.instruction: Key the feature possessed on the affix(es) that marks the alienably possessed nouns when they have a possessor. Also, key the feature possessed on all inalienably possessed nouns so that a possessor will be required.

radioGroup.prompt: ¿Se indican los sustantivos con un afijo que concuerda con el poseedor (o expresa posiblemente al poseedor por sí mismo)?

form.prompt:
Mire a través de las características en la carta abajo y compruebe cualquiera que su idioma utiliza. Para la concordancia de clase, substituya un tipo o un número como apropriado para ## en la gramática.
persona poss_first el poseedor debe ser primera persona
poss_exclusive el poseedor debe ser primera persona exclusiva
poss_inclusive el poseedor debe ser primera persona inclusiva
poss_second el poseedor debe ser segunda persona
poss_third el poseedor debe ser tercera persona
number poss_singular el poseedor debe ser singular en número
poss_plural el poseedor debe ser plural en número
poss_dual el poseedor debe ser dual en número
gender poss_masculine el poseedor debe ser masculino en género
poss_feminine el poseedor debe ser femenino en género
poss_neuter el poseedor debe ser neutro en género
animacy poss_animate el poseedor debe ser animado
poss_inanimate el poseedor debe ser inanimado
poss_human el poseedor debe ser humano
poss_nonhuman el poseedor debe ser no humano
class poss_class_## el poseedor debe ser de ## clase
form.instruction:
In the lexicon, add one or more features from the following list as appropriate to the affix entries. For class agreement, replace the ## with the appropriate class number up to 30 on the appropriate entries in the lexicon.
Note that this possessor agreement, at least in person features, cannot be tested until pronoun possessors are added in
Pronouns.
If you followed instructions, any agreement marking on nouns for number, gender, animacy and/or class should have already been done in the section on Articles and Demonstratives.

radioGroup.prompt: Did you already enter the agreement features on nouns or noun affixes?
radioGroup.radio: No, I still need to work on that

form.instruction: Since your language does not have articles or demonstratives, you did not add any agreement marking on nouns for number, gender, animacy and/or class in the section on Articles and Demonstratives. You need to do it now.

The instructions relevant to your language are given here.
Since your language does not have any agreement marking, you can continue on.
To handle the number agreement, we will assume that all nouns are singular by default. Therefore, only the plural nouns need to be marked. In the lexicon:
Add the feature plural to any affixes which can be added to a noun to make it plural.
Also, add the feature plural to any nouns which are inherently plural (such as scissors or pants in English), or exceptionally don't take an affix.
Any nouns which do not make a distinction between singular and plural forms, such as deer in English, need to have two entries in the lexicon, one marked with the feature plural and the other for singular (which can be explicitly marked or allowed to use the default). The parser will choose the correct form based on the context.
All mass nouns need to have the feature mass.
To handle animacy agreement, we will assume that all (common) nouns are inanimate and nonhuman by default. Therefore, only the animate nouns need to be marked. In the lexicon, add the feature animate to any animate nouns, such as person, people, crowd, animal, and names of types of animals which are not proper names. Also add the feature human as appropriate if your language makes the further distinction between human and nonhuman nouns. (Proper names will be dealt with in
Pronouns and Proper Names.)
To handle gender agreement, we will assume that all nouns are masculine by default. Therefore, only the feminine and neuter nouns need to be marked. In the lexicon:
Add the feature feminine to any affixes which can be added to a noun to make it feminine. Add the feature neuter to any affixes which can be added to a noun to make it neuter.
Also, add the feature feminine to any nouns which are inherently feminine, or exceptionally don't take an affix. Similarly, add the feature neuter to any nouns which are inherently neuter, or exceptionally don't take an affix.
Any nouns which do have the same form for both masculine and feminine, but which can take different forms of their modifiers based on gender need to have two entries in the lexicon, one marked with the feature feminine and the other for masculine (which can be explicitly marked or allowed to use the default). The parser will choose the correct form based on the context.
To handle class marking and agreement, in the lexicon:
It may be the case that the same affixes mark the class number on nouns and all their modifiers. If this is the case in your language, simply add the class feature class_## (where ## is replaced by a number between 1 and 99) to the affixes, and all the words will automatically come from the morphological parser with the class number marked.
Any cases where nouns do not have an affix which marks the class will require marking of the class feature on the particular noun.
